| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1405](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1405 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **rabbit**, r, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is an [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous"), [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [rodent](/wiki/Rodent "Rodent") that can be tamed with [carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot"), and shares a glyph with the [rabid rabbit](/wiki/Rabid_rabbit "Rabid rabbit").

A rabbit has a single bite attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)

## Generation

Rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

Rabbits appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest").

## Strategy

Rabbits are likely to be among the first monsters the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") will encounter, with a similar role to the [fox](/wiki/Fox "Fox") in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*: their higher speed of 15 can make their bites somewhat dangerous to starting characters. Thankfully, most roles and their starting pets are properly equipped to make quick work of rabbits - be sure not to confuse them with the more dangerous rabid rabbits.

## History

The rabbit first appears in [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Rabbit](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Rabbit "wikipedia:Special:Search/Rabbit")***

Rabbits, also known as bunnies or bunny rabbits, are small mammals in the family Leporidae (which also contains the hares) of the order Lagomorpha (which also contains the pikas). The European rabbit, which has been introduced on every continent except Antarctica, is familiar throughout the world as a wild prey animal and as a domesticated form of livestock and pet; the species and its descendants make up the world's 305 breeds of domestic rabbit. Although once considered rodents, lagomorphs like rabbits have been discovered to have diverged separately and earlier than their rodent cousins and have a number of traits rodents lack, like two extra incisors.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Rabbit

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
r rabbit
Difficulty 1
Attacks Bite 1d3
r rabbit
Difficulty 1
Attacks

Bite 1d3

Base level 0
Base experience 4
Speed 15
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 20
Nutritional value 12
Size Tiny
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A rabbit:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1405

A rabbit, r, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is an herbivorous, domestic rodent that can be tamed with carrots, and shares a glyph with the rabid rabbit.

A rabbit has a single bite attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin

Generation

Rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in Gehennom.

Rabbits appear among the random r that are part of the first quest monster class for Yeomen and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Yeoman quest.

Strategy

Rabbits are likely to be among the first monsters the hero will encounter, with a similar role to the fox in vanilla NetHack: their higher speed of 15 can make their bites somewhat dangerous to starting characters. Thankfully, most roles and their starting pets are properly equipped to make quick work of rabbits - be sure not to confuse them with the more dangerous rabid rabbits.

History

The rabbit first appears in NetHack-- 3.1.3.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Rabbit

Rabbits, also known as bunnies or bunny rabbits, are small mammals in the family Leporidae (which also contains the hares) of the order Lagomorpha (which also contains the pikas). The European rabbit, which has been introduced on every continent except Antarctica, is familiar throughout the world as a wild prey animal and as a domesticated form of livestock and pet; the species and its descendants make up the world's 305 breeds of domestic rabbit. Although once considered rodents, lagomorphs like rabbits have been discovered to have diverged separately and earlier than their rodent cousins and have a number of traits rodents lack, like two extra incisors.

A '''rabbit''', {{monsym|rabbit}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is an [[herbivorous]], [[domestic]] [[rodent]] that can be tamed with [[carrot]]s, and shares a glyph with the [[rabid rabbit]].

A rabbit has a single bite attack.

==Generation==
Rabbits are always generated hostile, and will not be randomly generated in [[Gehennom]].

Rabbits appear among the random {{white|r}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Yeomen]] and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Yeoman quest]]. 

==Strategy==
Rabbits are likely to be among the first monsters the [[hero]] will encounter, with a similar role to the [[fox]] in vanilla ''[[NetHack]]'': their higher speed of 15 can make their bites somewhat dangerous to starting characters. Thankfully, most roles and their starting pets are properly equipped to make quick work of rabbits - be sure not to confuse them with the more dangerous rabid rabbits.

==History==
The rabbit first appears in [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia}}
Rabbits, also known as bunnies or bunny rabbits, are small mammals in the family Leporidae (which also contains the hares) of the order Lagomorpha (which also contains the pikas). The European rabbit, which has been introduced on every continent except Antarctica, is familiar throughout the world as a wild prey animal and as a domesticated form of livestock and pet; the species and its descendants make up the world's 305 breeds of domestic rabbit. Although once considered rodents, lagomorphs like rabbits have been discovered to have diverged separately and earlier than their rodent cousins and have a number of traits rodents lack, like two extra incisors.
